metadata.title: CVE-2014-0198 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The do_ssl3_write function in s3_pkt.c in OpenSSL 1.x through 1.0.1g, whenSSL_MODE_RELEASE_BUFFERS is enabled, does not properly manage a bufferpointer during certain recursive calls, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash)via vectors that trigger an alert condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.1
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.1').
